pages.text: She has the lunar crescent at her feet, a horned diadem on her head, with a globe in the middle place, and a large solar cross on her breast.$(br)  The concealed scroll in her hands describes the Greater Law, the Secret Law. It is partly covered by her mantle, to show that some things are implied and some spoken.$(br)  She is seated between the white and black pillars - marked J and B - of the Mystic Temple Garden, and the veil of the Temple is behind her: it is

the color of mystery.$(br)  Her vestments are flowing and gauzy, and the mantle suggests light - a shimmering radiance.$(br)  She has been called Occult Science on the threshold of the Sanctuary of Nature, but she is really the Secret Church, the House which is of Divinity and Humanity. $(br)  She is the spiritual Bride and Mother, the daughter of the stars and the Higher Garden of Creation.$(br)  She is, in fine, the Queen of

the borrowed light, but this is the light of all.$(br) She is the moon nourished by the milk of the Great Mother. In a manner, she is also the Great Mother herself - she is the bright reflection.$(br)  Mystically speaking, she is the Spiritual Bride of the just human, and when they read the Law she gives the Divine meaning.$(br)  In some ways this card is the highest and holiest of the Major Arcana.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Stillness. Wisdom, intuition.$(br)  A sense of knowing things which cannot be explained in normal terms.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  A change from stillness to action.$(br)  Defending, or seeking out, what is rightfully yours.
